intro: Ceropegia somalensis, commonly known as the Somalian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are often clustered together. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Ceropegia somalensis is adapted to survive in regions with limited rainfall and high temperatures.
